business.headline: Shankh Air ready for takeoff: All you need to know about India's new airlineShankh Air, owned by Shankh Aviation Private Limited, has been granted a No Objection Certificate (NOC) by the ministry, valid for three years.

Sensex crosses 85,000, Nifty hits 26,000: Will bull run continue on D-Street? While Sensex and Nifty closed below record highs amid volatility, analysts remain cautiously optimistic, noting that Indian equities have defied global uncertainty to post strong gains this year.

Sensex, Nifty dip after hitting record highs; Tata Steel jumps 4%The Sensex settled 14.57 points lower at 84,929.25 after crossing 85,000 for the first time, while the NSE Nifty50 ended 1.35 points higher at 25,940.40 after crossing 26,000.

NPS Vatsalya: Is it the right choice for parents?Unlike other financial products aimed at short-term goals like education or marriage, NPS Vatsalya focusses solely on long-term retirement savings for the child.

Western Carriers shares list at 1% discount. Should you hold or sell? Western Carriers market listing: The company's stock opened at Rs 170 on the BSE, which is 1.16% below its issue price of Rs 172. On the NSE, the shares listed at Rs 171, down by Rs 1, or 0.6%.

Explained: Why Exxaro Tiles shares jumped over 18% todayThe company stock price rose as much as 18.4% to Rs 94.96 in early trade. At 2 pm, shares of Exxaro Tiles were trading 17.24% higher at Rs 94.25.

Northern Arc Capital shares list at 33% premium over IPO price. Hold or sell?Northern Arc Capital IPO listing: The stock opened at Rs 351 on the Bombay Stock Exchange, up 33.5% from its issue price of Rs 263. Similarly, it listed at Rs 350 on the National Stock Exchange.

Arkade Developers shares gain 37% on listing: Should you book profit or hold?Arkade Developers stock opened at Rs 175 on the Bombay Stock Exchange, a 36.72% jump from its issue price of Rs 128. On the National Stock Exchange, the shares listed at Rs 175.90, reflecting a similar premium of 37.42%.

Paytm shares jump over 3% after Emkay's rating upgrade. More upside ahead?Paytm share price: The rally comes after Emkay Global Financial Services upgraded its rating on One97 Communications from 'Reduce' to 'Add' while doubling its target price to Rs 750 per share from the previous Rs 375.

Byju's faces setback as US court upholds $1.2 billion loan default rulingThe court's decision supports an earlier ruling made by the Delaware Court of Chancery, which allowed the company's lenders, represented by Glas Trust LLC, to seize control of Byju's Alpha Inc

JSW Group to shift Rs 40,000 crore EV project from Odisha to Maharashtra: ReportJSW Group, led by Sajjan Jindal, is now eyeing Maharashtra, with Aurangabad and Nagpur emerging as the top contenders for the large-scale EV and battery project.
Manaba Finance IPO Day 2: Check latest subscription, expected listing gains The IPO of Manba Finnace is a fresh issue of 1.26 crore shares and closes for subscription on September 25, 2024.

Vodafone Idea shares fall 2% as ICICI Securities cuts target price ICICI Securities has reduced Vodafone Idea's EV/EBITDA multiple to 13 times FY27 from 14 times and lowered its target price to Rs 11 from Rs 15.

NTPC Green Energy IPO: Can It supercharge NTPC's stock growth?NTPC's performance in the last two years has largely been driven by its growing renewable energy (RE) business, which is expected to go public in the first half of FY2025.

Gold, silver price today, September 24, 2024: Precious metals record hike on MCXGold Price Today September 24, 2024: Both gold and silver are trading on the higher side of the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX) on Tuesday. Check the latest city-wise prices here.

Arkade Developers shares make strong D-Street debut, lists at 37% premiumArkade Developers listing: Shares of the real estate company listed at Rs 175 on the Bombay Exchange (BSE) at a premium of 36.72% over its issue price of Rs 128.

Western Carriers makes weak D-Street debut, lists at 1% discountWestern Carriers market listing: Despite the weak listing, the IPO received strong investor interest, being oversubscribed nearly 31 times, primarily driven by non-institutional investors.

Northern Arc Capital shares list at 33% premium, misses GMP Northern Arc Capital listing: The shares opened at Rs 351, with a premium of 33.5% over the IPO price of Rs 263 per share on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).
Sensex crosses 85,000 for 1st time, Nifty hits record highAs of 10:05 AM, the S&P BSE Sensex had risen 80.74 points to 85,009.35, while the NSE Nifty50 was up 29.15 points to 25,968.20.

Sensex, Nifty slip from record highs amid rising Middle East tensionsThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 107.07 points to 84,821.54 at around 9:16 am, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 23.50 points to trade at 25,915.55.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Voting underway for 2nd phase of J&K Assembly polls, Omar Abdullah in running Live UpdatesThe People's Democratic Party has fielded 26 candidates, the highest number, followed by the National Conference with 20, BJP with 17, and the Congress with six. There are 170 independent and other candidates.

When I said 75% issues sorted, I meant...: S Jaishankar on China border rowExternal Affairs Minister S Jaishankar touched upon the India-China border tensions and said that disengagement of troops was only done when he meant that 75 per cent of the dispute had been sorted.

Shots fired at Kamala Harris's poll campaign office in ArizonaThis is the second time in a month that the campaign office in Arizona's Tempe city was targeted after the front windows of the establishment were shot at using a pellet gun on September 16.

Who's who of politics, films, tech to converge at India Today's Mumbai ConclaveThis year's conclave in Mumbai promises to be a riveting affair, coming on the heels of the high-voltage Lok Sabha elections and weeks ahead of the Maharashtra Assembly polls.

Video: UK PM calls for return of 'sausages' from Gaza. He meant hostagesUK Prime Minister Keir Starmer made a gaffe when he said "return of sausages" instead of "return of hostages" while urging the release of Israeli civilians by Hamas in Gaza.

My views are personal: Kangana Ranaut after BJP condemns her farm law remarksAs her comments drew sharp criticism from the BJP, the Mandi Lok Sabha MP acknowledged that her remarks were personal and had nothing to do with the party.

Video: Dance at Chennai doctors' conference triggers row for being 'vulgar'A dance performance at a Chennai medical conference has triggered a row. Several social media users shared the video and questioned the event, criticising the event for its "vulgarity".

Exclusive: Vinesh Phogat says entering politics not a choice, but a necessityIn an exclusive interview with India Today TV, Vinesh Phogat spoke in detail about her decision to enter politics, about why she chose to contest on Congress ticket, and what is her vision for Haryana.

Ranbir Kapoor, Neetu 'screamed the loudest' for Alia Bhatt at Paris Fashion WeekNeetu Kapoor had the loudest cheer for her daughter-in-law Alia Bhatt as she made her Paris Fashion Week debut. The veteran actor shared a video on Instagram and expressed her love for Alia.

EY India office whose employee died lacked labour welfare permit: SourcesAccording to sources, the EY India unit, which has been running since 2007 in Pune, does not have a Shop Act licence, which regulates work conditions, including employee rights, working hours, wages, and safety.
Joe Biden meets Muhammad Yunus, offers US's full support to BangladeshAccording to a press note, Joe Biden said if the students could sacrifice so much for their country, "they too should do more".

No one called me: Vinesh Phogat claims lack of support in OlympicsWrestler Vinesh Phogat said that she lacked support when she took part in the Paris Olympics where she was disqualified from her 50kg final bout.

Watch: Pet dog fights off cobra to protect children in Uttar Pradesh's JhansiA pit bull fought off a venomous cobra and saved the lives of children playing in the garden in Uttar Pradesh's Jhansi. The video of the dog's brave actions has gone viral on social media. The snake had entered the garden while the children were playing outside. Upon hearing the children's screams, the pit bull, named Genie, broke free from its leash and attacked the cobra. The dog bit the snake and repeatedly slammed it to the ground, eventually killing it.

Pawan Kalyan vs Prakash Raj over Tirupati laddu row: 'Attack on Sanatana Dharma'Pawan Kalyan has called the adulteration in Tirupati laddus an attack on Sanatana Dharma. He questioned actor Prakash Raj after the latter criticised his statement.

UP man gets life term for raping mother, asking her to live with him as wifeA 36-year-old man was sentenced to life imprisonment for raping his 60-year-old widowed mother and asking her to live with him as his wife in Uttar Pradesh's Bulandshahr.

Don't want to be sandwiched between China and India: New Sri Lanka PresidentIn an interview, the new Sri Lankan President said that the island nation would not align itself with any 'power camp' and that both India and China are valued friends.

How listening to loud music can lead to hearing disorders in young peopleThe increasing use of earphones among the young people is raising serious public health concerns, with many at risk of developing noise-induced hearing disorders.

Dubai-bound flight delayed after smoke comes out of plane at Chennai airportAlthough the actual cause of the smoke is yet to be determined, sources suggest that heat generated due to excess fuel in the fuel tank could be the reason behind it.

Joe Biden calls for peace in Middle East in his final UN Assembly addressIn his last speech as president before the United Nations General Assembly, Joe Biden said that a diplomatic solution between Israel and Lebanon's Hezbollah was possible and that Russia's war in Ukraine had failed.

Badlapur accused's father seeks court-monitored SIT probe into son's encounterA petition has been filed in the Bombay High Court by the father of the Badlapur sex abuse accused Akshay Shinde, seeking a court-monitored Special Investigation Team (SIT) to probe his son's encounter.

Are Urmila Matondkar, husband Mohsin getting a divorce? Here's the truthRumours are rife that actor-politician Urmila Matondkar and her husband Mohsin Akhtar Mir are getting a divorce. Sources close to the couple exclusively told India Today Digital that they're indeed separated.

Jury chief on Laapataa Ladies as India's entry for Oscars: It depicts our societyIn an interview with India Today, filmmaker Jahnu Barua, who headed the 13-member committee that made the unanimous decision to select Laapataa Ladies for Oscar 2025, said that the film stood out as it highlighted several issues uniquely related to women.

Kamala Harris leads Trump by 38 points among Asian American voters: SurveyAs many as 66 per cent of Asian American voters plan on voting for Harris, compared to 28 per cent who say they back former president Trump. Those who say they will support another candidate or are undecided account for six per cent.

This fraud must end now: Supreme Court rejects Punjab's plea linked to NRI quotaThe Punjab government had challenged a High Court order, which trashed its August 20 notification extending the ambit of the NRI quota to include distant relatives "such as uncles, aunts, grandparents, and cousins" for admissions in medical colleges.

Madhura Pandit Jasraj, wife of late Pandit Jasraj, dies of illnessLate Pandit Jasraj's wife Madhura Jasraj died following an age-related illness. Her funeral will take place at the Oshiwara crematorium on September 25 at 4 pm.

Video: Nayanthara sings and dances as she gets her ear pierced in GreeceNayanthara got one of her ears pierced in Greece. She shared a funny video, which gives a glimpse of her playful reactions while getting pierced.

Pawan Kalyan addresses Karthi's apology on Tirupathi laddu comment, Suriya respondsTamil actor Suriya thanked Pawan Kalyan after he addressed Karthi's apology over the laddu controversy. Karthi's comments sparked mixed reactions in the industry.

Ranbir Kapoor, Neetu 'screamed the loudest' for Alia Bhatt at Paris Fashion WeekNeetu Kapoor had the loudest cheer for her daughter-in-law Alia Bhatt as she made her Paris Fashion Week debut. The veteran actor shared a video on Instagram and expressed her love for Alia.

sports.headline: Leny Yoro reveals why he chose Manchester United: Everything is big hereLeny Yoro has revealed the reason why he decided to join Manchester United during the summer transfer window. United signed Yoro after beating serious competition from some big names.

Virat Kohli, Rishabh Pant named in Delhi's probable squadStar Indian cricketers Virat Kohli and Rishabh Pant have been named in Delhi's probable squad for the 2024-25 Ranji Trophy season. Their inclusion has generated excitement amongst fans, despite uncertainties surrounding their participation due to international commitments.

'Irreplaceable' Rodri out for a long time: Manchester City boss Pep GuardiolaManchester City manager Pep Guardiola has confirmed that Rodri will be out "for a long time" because of a knee injury he suffered against Arsenal.
Harmanpreet Kaur-led Indian team leaves for UAEThe Harmanpreet Kaur-led side has left for ICC Women's T20 World Cup 2024 which is all set to take place in the United Arab Emirates (UAE).

Stokes ready for England white-ball return under coach Brendon McCullumEngland Test captain Ben Stokes has opened the door to a possible return to white-ball cricket under coach Brendon McCullum, though no formal talks have occurred. Stokes emphasises his current focus on the upcoming Test series in Pakistan.

After WBBL snub, India's Shreyanka Patil aims to become the 'best all-rounder'India's Shreyanka Patil has set her goal of becoming a quality all-rounder after not finding a team in the WBBL. In an exclusive interview with Indiatodayin, Shreyanka also spoke about her memorable season with RCB in the WPL 2024.

Harry Brook's maiden ODI hundred keeps England afloat in ODI series  ENG vs AUS: Harry Brook scored 110 runs off 94 balls as England made it 1-2 in the series with a 46-run win over Australia at the Riverside Ground in Chester-Le-Street.

Pakistan name squad for 1st Test vs England, Noman replaces ShahzadPAK vs ENG: Left-arm spinner Noman Ali has replaced injured fast bowler Khurram Shahzad as Pakistan named a 15-member squad for the opening Test against England.

Sachin wishes son Arjun on birthday: 'Your love for life inspires me'Sachin Tendulkar penned a heartfelt message for son Arjun on his 25th birthday, praising his dedication to cricket and life. Despite setbacks, Arjun's resilience continues to inspire, following his best-ever first-class bowling performance for Goa.

Nathan Lyon reveals game plan against old foe Rishabh Pant before AUS vs IND TestsNathan Lyon revealed his game plan against old foe, Rishabh Pant, in the lead-up to the Border Gavaskar Trophy series. Interestingly, Lyon has dismissed Pant in five out of the seven encounters.

Best team India are going forward with for T20 World Cup: Harmanpreet KaurWomen's T20 World Cup 2024: Harmanpreet Kaur said that the Indian team has prepared well and have all their boxes ticked before they head to the United Arab Emirates for the upcoming event.

United's Ten Hag demands 'trust' in his decision to drop Marcus RashfordErik ten Hag has dismissed rumors of a fallout with Marcus Rashford after benching him against Crystal Palace, urging fans and pundits to trust his decisions amid concerns over the forward's recent dip in form.

Women's T20 World Cup 2024: Cricketers to have played in all 9 editions Women's T20 World Cup 2024: Indian skipper Harmanpreet Kaur and Australian all-rounder Ellyse Perry are two of the cricketers who have played in all nine editions of the mega event.

Hard for Rishabh Pant to go past MS Dhoni In terms of hero factor: Ian SmithIan Smith hailed Rishabh Pant for his attitude and the comeback which he pulled off. However, he felt that Pant cannot go past MS Dhoni in terms of the hero factor.

Arjun Tendulkar turns 25: Sara sends heartfelt wishes for her brotherSachin Tendulkar's daughter Sara extended her birthday wishes to brother Arjun via an Instagram post. Arjun turned 25 on September 24, Tuesday.

Watch: Hasnain dismisses Rizwan for 0 in fiery spell in Champions Cup Pakistan Champions Cup: Mohammad Hasnain picked up three wickets in his opening spell as the Panthers bowled Markhors out for 137 in 36 overs in the Qualifier.

Inspired by younger self, Harmanpreet looks to thrive under pressureWomen's T20 World Cup: Indian captain Harmanpreet Kaur said that she wants to play with full freedom as she gets set to step for her ninth edition in the tournament.

Jurel, Dayal named in Irani Cup squad subject to Kanpur Test participationIrani Cup 2024: Wicketkeeper-batter Dhruv Jurel and fast bowler Yash Dayal were named in the Rest of India, but their availability will be subject to their participation in the second Test against Bangladesh. The Irani Cup between Mumbai and Rest of India will be played in Lucknow from October 1-5.

T20 World Cup 2024: Harmanpreet Kaur confident of overcoming Australia threat Harmanpreet Kaur is confident of the Indian team overcoming the Australia threat in the upcoming T20 World Cup 2024. India lost the tournament's final in 2020 and semi-final in 2023 to Australia.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
